title: TB will not retrieve POP mail since 12/19/25; IMAP on same accounts fine
content:
Hi, TB will not retrieve POP mail since 12/19/25; IMAP on same accounts fine (smart phone, notebook, etc.).

Host email server says no changes, and I have made no changes. Odd. *Something* obviously "changed", and only affected POP collection. Kindly, does anyone have an idea as to what variables to pursue?

Win 11 (all latest updates), TB latest update (140.6.0esr), no 3rd party VP, etc.

Thx in advance, Tom

title: Completely disable anti-spam
content:
Introduce a way to completely disable anti-spam. It is a totally undesirable and inconvenient feature for many users. I have tried to disable it in every way, but I have not been able to. It has caused me serious inconvenience and damage.

I have been using Thunderbird for over 10 years, and I have thought about replacing it a few times due to this anti-spam issue.

title: Emails lost on my [edited] @bigpond.com after recent update Australia
content: I use Thunderbird as my email client for my HP Laptop,for a number of email addresses. Working well. Curiously after an update to my to my password in my Telstra BigPond Australia email address- [edited] @bigpond.com & coincidently within a day of the December 10, 2025 Thunderbird update- All my emails disappeared. OTHER emails remained untouched. My email account address line appears. The Inbox, Sent, Deleted labels appear, but empty. Please help. Could it be a 'profile" issue. The server settings appear correct when using Google mail on my phone. My email [edited[ @bigpond works on my Android A55 mobile. Your assistance would be greatly appreciated. Kind regards A backup email address is itrainielts.com. Pranas Kriauza phone [edited phone# and address details from public support forum]

title: Thunderbird 50% version don't work. "Authentication failed. Please check that your username and password are correct. exchange auth error..."
content:
I used to use the basic version of Thunderbird on a daily basis, but after a while it became buggy and didn't work properly. I've been using Thunderbird beta for 3 months now. I had to take a break from work because I need to add multiple Outlook emails to Thunderbird online for one thing. I've been doing the same thing for three days now, adding emails to receive notifications about shipments ready for pickup.

After adding 2 to 5 accounts, a message pops up saying that my data is incorrect, but it is 100% correct. When I try again, an exchange error pops up, and when I check through my regular browser, I can log in and check my mailbox normally, but it does not connect to Thunderbird beta or Thunderbird daily.

And so, for 3 days, I added 2 to 5 accounts correctly, and then finally, no account wants to be added. I checked that Thunderbird has no limit, I saw about 300 accounts per day, but the accounts I'm doing are a ridiculous limit and I have some problem with the application, and before I used it the same way I do now and had no problems. Thunderbird Daily works just as badly, no works from 2 to 5 accounts, then an error pops up. What's going on with this???!?!
creator: asotek62

title: Local Folders missing and Folder Pane unresponsive in Thunderbird 128 (Nebula)
content:
"Hello, I am having trouble with my Thunderbird interface. I am trying to import a 6GB MBOX file using the 'ImportExportTools NG' add-on, but I cannot proceed because:

The Folder Pane is visible but completely empty (blank).

Even though 'Local Folders' should be enabled in the settings, the header 'Local Folders' does not appear in the left column.

In the Folder Pane header menu (...), the option 'Hide Local Folders' is visible, which suggests they are supposed to be shown, but they remain invisible.

I have already donated, but the 'Place to Freedom' (Donation) tab is taking up half my screen and I cannot find the 'X' to close it.

How can I force the 'Local Folders' to reappear in the side pane so I can perform my import?

Thank you for your help."
creator: pauletche7

title: Outlook account login fails
content:
I've had an Email account with outlook.com for years using Thunderbird. 2 days ago, Outlook forced me to change my password to login using a webbrowser. I changed the account password in Thunderbird and now I can't login. No matter what I try (and the experimental account setup is disabled), I simply get a pop-up window I guess from Outlook stating it can't log me in because cookies are disabled. I don't know which browser this pop-up is trying to use. I've got 3 web browsers (firefox, brave, librefox) on this linux mint PC. I have enabled all cookies in all 3 browsers, but the same error message occurs.

I'm using Thunderbird 140.5.0esr (64-bit) and it worked just fine until the password change. I have deleted all accounts in Thunderbird now and am trying to add my primary outlook account back. This is beyond frustrating. Hoping somebody can help.
creator: tlbpjb

title: E-mail not delivered

creator: penname1

title: Funding decisions?
content:
Of course there is no category for general concerns, so category choice is wrong by default, sorry about that.

The recent "year in review" included this attached bit. Does that mean that the Mozilla foundation is deciding to not allocate any of their overall revenue to Thunderbird and rely solely on user donations for it? If so, why does it own/manage Thunderbird? To me the entire purpose of an entity like Mozilla managing a project like Thunderbird is like most companies, to be able to allocate extra revenue from more lucrative projects to ones that are less so. Seems that the userbase of a project you own doesn't matter, money^s somehow better allocated to stuff that nobody asked for?
creator: Kilrah

title: Thunderbird suddenly unable to write e-mail to the mailbox
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 140.6.0esr under 64-bit LMDE (Linux Mint Debian Edition) v6.0, fully up to date with patches.

Last night, Thunderbird was working justfine when I switched the PC off. This morning, when I try to collect mail, I get a dialog box with the message

Unable to write the e-mail to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.

I have multiple Terabytes free on the drive, and I have gone through a full file listing and checked all the file attributes. Yes, I have write access.

Just to be sure, I ran a chown against the entire ~/thunderbird directory (~/.thunderbird is a logical link) so I own ~/thunderbird and everything beneath.

I also ran a fsck on the drive, and fsck gave it a clean bill of health - no errors reported. This was just a normal fsck, not including a badblocks check, although I did run badblocks against the drive when I got it new, about two months ago.

I am out of ideas. I suppose I could try running TB with a sudo, but I'm not really happy with doing that routinely.

Does anybody have any ideas? . Thanks,

Brian.
creator: brian187
